summary_text: ChatGPT parent company OpenAI announced on Wednesday it is launching a pilot subscription plan for its popular AI-powered chatbot, called ChatGPT Plus. The company said that the pilot version will initially be rolled out to a limited number of users on the waiting list but said it is planning to make the service available to the wider public.

Just two months after its launch, OpenAIs ChatGPT has reached 100 million monthly active users. In comparison, it took TikTok about nine months to reach 100 million users and Instagram 2 and a half years. OpenAI has already announced a $20 monthly subscription for users in the United States.

ChatGPT has taken the tech world by storm in just a few short months. The viral success of the chatbot, made by OpenAI, has caused a huge ripple across the tech industry. In 2022, investors put at least $1.37 billion into generative AI startups.
